flavor: Light up, flame out, and burn it all down.
stripped_text: The first time each turn a run becomes successful after a subroutine resolved during that run, gain 1 credit and the Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
stripped_title: Ryo "Phoenix" Ono: Out of the Ashes
text: The first time each turn a run becomes successful after a subroutine resolved during that run, gain 1[credit] and the Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
title: Ryō “Phoenix” Ōno: Out of the Ashes

flavor: Whatever it takes for us to survive.
stripped_text: Once per turn -> click: Install 1 card from your grip, paying 2 credits less. When you install that card, suffer 1 meat damage.
text: Once per turn → [click]: Install 1 card from your grip, paying 2[credit] less. When you install that card, suffer 1 meat damage.
title: Topan: Ormas Leader

flavor: “I’ll use what I have to get what I want.”
stripped_text: Run Archives. When that run ends, you may trash 1 rezzed copy of a card you accessed in Archives during that run.
text: Run Archives. When that run ends, you may trash 1 rezzed copy of a card you accessed in Archives during that run.
title: Charm Offensive

flavor:
“99% of everything is trash. That’s why I pay someone else to search it for me.”
—Sturg3on_General
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend click. Install 1 program from your heap. You may add 1 program from your heap to the bottom of your stack.
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Install 1 program from your heap. You may add 1 program from your heap to the bottom of your stack.
title: Scrounge

flavor: The volume is the message.
stripped_text: Run any server. The first time the Corp would end that run, prevent the run from ending unless the Corp reveals and trashes X cards from HQ at random. X is equal to the number of cards in the root of the attacked server.
text: Run any server. The first time the Corp would end that run, prevent the run from ending unless the Corp reveals and trashes X cards from HQ at random. X is equal to the number of cards in the root of the attacked server.
title: Shred

stripped_text: +1 mu Whenever you install a card without spending credits, you may host the top card of your stack faceup on this hardware. (It is not installed.) You can play or install hosted cards as if they were in your grip. When your discard phase ends, trash all hosted cards. Limit 1 console per player.
text: +1[mu] Whenever you install a card without spending credits, you may host the top card of your stack faceup on this hardware. (It is not installed.) You can play or install hosted cards as if they were in your grip. When your discard phase ends, trash all hosted cards. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Bling

stripped_text: Access -> trash: Trash the non-agenda card you are accessing. If you do, draw 1 card.
text: Access → [trash]: Trash the non-agenda card you are accessing. If you do, draw 1 card.
title: Gourmand

flavor:
“I’m on retainer for monthly purges on thirty-six different servers.”
—Ratu Maharani, pawang virus
stripped_text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine. Hosted virus counter: +2 strength.
text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. Hosted virus counter: +2 strength.
title: Hantu

flavor: The waters begin to roil, and bit by bit they swell.
stripped_text: This program gets +1 strength for each fracter in your heap. Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength.
text: This program gets +1 strength for each fracter in your heap. Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
title: Rising Tide

flavor:
“Nil SIR, black noise, lost girls, drowned boys!”
—Ryō “Phoenix” Ōno
stripped_text: The first time each turn you steal or trash a Corp card, place 1 power counter on this resource. When your action phase ends, you may remove 2 hosted power counters to sabotage 3. (The Corp trashes 3 cards of their choice from HQ and/or the top of R&D.)
text: The first time each turn you steal or trash a Corp card, place 1 power counter on this resource. When your action phase ends, you may remove 2 hosted power counters to sabotage 3. (The Corp trashes 3 cards of their choice from HQ and/or the top of R&D.)
title: Cacophony

flavor: “In the end, they raised the rent and we were out on the street. But the riots had tanked property values so much we moved back in—with a better deal!”
stripped_text: click click click,trash: Gain 9 credits.
text: [click][click][click],[trash]: Gain 9[credit].
title: Rent Rioters

flavor: Try me.
stripped_text: Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, you may install 1 resource or piece of hardware from your grip.
text: Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, you may install 1 resource or piece of hardware from your grip.
title: Barry “Baz” Wong: Tri-Maf Veteran

flavor: Peer pressure works.
stripped_text: When your turn begins, look at the top card of your stack. If that card is an icebreaker or a run event, you may reveal it and add it to your grip.
text: When your turn begins, look at the top card of your stack. If that card is an icebreaker or a run event, you may reveal it and add it to your grip.
title: MuslihaT: Multifarious Marketeer

flavor:
“…one-hundred and twenty-seven rounds fired, and two police hoppers totaled. Miraculously, no officers were hurt, though the suspect remains at large.”
—Abdul el-Sattar, KKN 6
stripped_text: Run any server. If successful, gain 6 credits.
text: Run any server. If successful, gain 6[credit].
title: Clean Getaway

flavor: “Pity the money’s being spent here, when I could be buying hiasan for my apartment.”
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend click. Resolve 1 of the following: * Draw 4 cards. * Remove up to 2 tags.
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Resolve 1 of the following:
  • Draw 4 cards.
  • Remove up to 2 tags.
title: Lie Low

flavor:
“Don’t let self-respect get in the way of a good shortcut.”
—“G0ph3r” OʼRyan
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend click. Run Archives. When you would approach Archives (after passing all ice), instead change the attacked server to HQ and approach HQ.
text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Run Archives. When you would approach Archives (after passing all ice), instead change the attacked server to HQ and approach HQ.
title: Maintenance Access

flavor:
“In KK, we say ‘harimau mati karena belangnya’. It means don't tell the world how much money you have if you plan on keeping it.”
—JokoR
stripped_text: Run HQ. If successful, take 1 tag and the Corp loses 3 credits. Gain 2 credits for each credit lost this way.
text: Run HQ. If successful, take 1 tag and the Corp loses 3[credit]. Gain 2[credit] for each credit lost this way.
title: Transfer of Wealth

stripped_text: +1 mu The first time each turn you make a successful run on HQ, you may host 1 card from HQ at random faceup on this hardware. (It is not installed or rezzed.) click, add 2 hosted cards to HQ: The Runner may access 1 card in HQ at random. Any player can use this ability. Limit 1 console per player.
text: +1[mu] The first time each turn you make a successful run on HQ, you may host 1 card from HQ at random faceup on this hardware. (It is not installed or rezzed.) [click], add 2 hosted cards to HQ: The Runner may access 1 card in HQ at random. Any player can use this ability. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Detente

flavor:
“You think I’ve finished messing with you?
Yeah, nah.”
—Barry “Baz” Wong
stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, you may trash this hardware to derez 1 installed Corp card.
text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, you may trash this hardware to derez 1 installed Corp card.
title: Maglectric Rapid (748 Mod)

flavor: Consequences only matter if they catch you.
stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 3 credits: +2 strength. If a run event is active, this ability costs 2 credits less to use.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 3[credit]: +2 strength. If a run event is active, this ability costs 2[credit] less to use.
title: Sang Kancil

flavor:
“She’s learned from the best: me. When I retire, the KK Tri-Maf’ll be in good hands.”
—Barry “Baz” Wong
stripped_text: The rez cost of each piece of ice is increased by 1 credit. Whenever you encounter a piece of ice, if the Corp has 15 credits or more, you may trash this resource to bypass that ice. (Pass that ice. No subroutines or further "when encountered" abilities resolve.)
text: The rez cost of each piece of ice is increased by 1[credit]. Whenever you encounter a piece of ice, if the Corp has 15[credit] or more, you may trash this resource to bypass that ice. (Pass that ice. No subroutines or further "when encountered" abilities resolve.)
title: Fransofia Ward

flavor:
“That kepo NBN gang makes trillions off incidental data scraping. So what if I use it to network?”
—MuslihaT
stripped_text: When you install this resource, load 6 credits onto it. When it is empty, trash it. You can spend hosted credits to install connection and job resources. When your turn begins, take 1 credit from this resource.
text: When you install this resource, load 6[credit] onto it. When it is empty, trash it. You can spend hosted credits to install connection and job resources. When your turn begins, take 1[credit] from this resource.
title: Open Market

flavor:
Who else will teach the stories of good and evil?
We can’t leave the corps’ dirty deeds in the shadows.
stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run, if your  mu is full, you may flip this identity and gain 1 credit. Flip side: Whenever you make a successful run, if you have at least 1 unused  mu, you may flip this identity and draw 1 card.
text:
Whenever you make a successful run, if your [mu] is full, you may flip this identity and gain 1[credit].
Flip side:
Whenever you make a successful run, if you have at least 1 unused [mu], you may flip this identity and draw 1 card.
title: Dewi Subrotoputri: Pedagogical Dhalang

flavor: Good design is invisible—but I’ll never settle for ‘good’.
stripped_text: Whenever you discard cards to reach your maximum hand size, you may install 1 program or piece of hardware from among those cards.
text: Whenever you discard cards to reach your maximum hand size, you may install 1 program or piece of hardware from among those cards.
title: Magdalene Keino-Chemutai: Cryptarchitect

flavor: “Won’t she get in trouble for putting that in the show? And how did she even find out?!”
stripped_text: Run R&D. If successful, install up to 3 cards from your grip (one at a time), paying 1 credit less for each.
text: Run R&D. If successful, install up to 3 cards from your grip (one at a time), paying 1[credit] less for each.
title: Illumination

flavor: Every day starts the same: tea, news, a threedee puzzle. Then it’s off to work. Magdalene won’t let being fired get in the way of completing her masterpiece.
stripped_text: Draw 1 card for each click you have remaining.
text: Draw 1 card for each [click] you have remaining.
title: Ritual

stripped_text: When you install this hardware and when your turn begins, you may host this hardware on an installed non-AI icebreaker. Host icebreaker gets +1 strength. Abilities that increase its strength last for the remainder of the run (instead of any shorter duration).
text: When you install this hardware and when your turn begins, you may host this hardware on an installed non-AI icebreaker. Host icebreaker gets +1 strength. Abilities that increase its strength last for the remainder of the run (instead of any shorter duration).
title: GAMEDRAGON™ Pro

stripped_text: click: Host any number of programs from your grip faceup on this hardware. (They are not installed.) Once per turn -> 0 credits: Install 1 hosted program (paying its install cost). Limit 1 console per player.
text: [click]: Host any number of programs from your grip faceup on this hardware. (They are not installed.) Once per turn → 0[credit]: Install 1 hosted program (paying its install cost). Limit 1 console per player.
title: Madani

flavor:
“For my children’s sake, I’ll endure any pain.”
—Dewi Subrotoputri, as Dyah Kunthi
stripped_text: 2 recurring credits (When you install this program and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs.
text: 2[recurring-credit] (When you install this program and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs.
title: Azimat

flavor:
“The Net operates almost as much on dream logic as it does digital logic. If you believe something to be true, it often is.”
—The Encyclopedia Silica
stripped_text: Install only on a piece of ice. Host ice gains barrier, code gate, and sentry.
text: Install only on a piece of ice. Host ice gains barrier, code gate, and sentry.
title: Chromatophores

flavor:
“I still have friends on the inside.”
—Magdalene Keino-Chemutai

text:
When you install this program, place 2 power counters on it.
Whenever you breach R&D, you may remove 1 hosted power counter to access 1 additional card.
title: Devadatta Drone

flavor: On the shoulders of giants.
stripped_text: This program costs 1 credit less to install for each other installed icebreaker. (Programs trashed as part of installing this program don't count.) Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 2 credits: +2 strength.
text: This program costs 1[credit] less to install for each other installed icebreaker. (Programs trashed as part of installing this program don’t count.) Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength.
title: Principia

flavor: There are a hundred currencies in the undercity, and Knickknack takes them all. Creds and rupiah get you noodles. For his secret menu, he’ll take your burnt-out rigs, your sterilized virii. But to taste his smoked vatchicken stew, bring him what he values most: your story.
stripped_text: The first time each turn a run begins, you may trash 1 of your other installed cards. If you do, gain credits equal to its printed install cost and draw 1 card.
text: The first time each turn a run begins, you may trash 1 of your other installed cards. If you do, gain credits equal to its printed install cost and draw 1 card.
title: “Knickknack” O’Brian

flavor:
“They were fast, friendly, and efficient. ★★★★☆.”
—satisfied customer
stripped_text: When you install this resource and whenever a run begins, place 1 credit on this resource. When there are 6 or more hosted credits, take all credits from this resource, trash it, and draw 1 card.
text:
When you install this resource and whenever a run begins, place 1[credit] on this resource.
When there are 6 or more hosted credits, take all credits from this resource, trash it, and draw 1 card.

flavor: Workers of the World, Delivered.

text: Once per turn → Trash 1 rezzed bioroid card in the root of or protecting the attacked server: End the run.

flavor: Fashion fades. Poétrï is eternal.

flavor: “Don’t tell me you were at the gala, darling? I must not have seen you!”

flavor: “Deploying in T-minus 5…”

text: [click][click][click], [trash]: Gain 4[credit] and draw 3 cards. Install up to 2 cards from HQ (one at a time). You may play 1 operation from HQ.
title: Humanoid Resources

flavor: “Don’t be scared of the Ottos, kiddo. They’re building our future!”

title: Otto Campaign

flavor: “You dare?”

text: When you rez this ice during a run against this server, you may trash 1 installed trojan program. Lose [click]: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. [subroutine] Trash 1 installed program. [subroutine] Do 1 core damage.
title: Bumi 1.0

flavor:
“It is a fallacy that conscious observation can change reality. The consciousness of the observer isn’t required at all.”
—The Encyclopedia Silica

text:
While this ice is the only piece of ice protecting this server, it gets +4 strength.
[subroutine] You may install 1 card from HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Scatter Field

flavor:
“I am a very reasonable manager. I do not expect my staff to do anything I could not do.”
—Bass CH1R180G4
stripped_text: Gain click click.
text: Gain [click][click].
title: Nanomanagement

flavor:
“The instability of human braintapes is directly proportional to the number of limbs on a given bioroid, so we’ve begun phasing them out for something better-equipped. A human braintape could be working beside an octopus for weeks and never have an inkling.”
—Maía Mínervudóttir, R&D
stripped_text: Draw 2 cards. Install up to 2 cards from HQ (one at a time).
text: Draw 2 cards. Install up to 2 cards from HQ (one at a time).
title: Top-Down Solutions

flavor: “My predecessor had passion, imagination, ambition. I assure you, I possess no such flaws.”

text: When your action phase ends, you may install 1 piece of ice from HQ, paying 1[credit] less. If you do, move this upgrade to the root of the server that piece of ice is protecting.

flavor: The Looming Future.

text: When your discard phase ends, if there are 3 or fewer cards in HQ, you may pay 1[credit] to place 1 advancement counter on an unrezzed card you can advance. (You cannot score that card this turn.)
title: PT Untaian: Life's Building Blocks

flavor: We rely too much on spatial cognition. What happens when that system receives a null signal?

text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it. Hosted agenda counter: The Runner moves to the outermost position of Archives. (They approach any ice in that position.) Use this ability only during a run.

flavor: You thought you were safe?

While the Runner is accessing this asset in R&D, they must reveal it.

flavor: “I make the best company.”

title: Phật Gioan Baotixita

flavor: Jinteki’s most experimental ice are often their most dangerous.

title: Mycoweb

flavor: The silence of the forest is the surest sign of danger.

text: The Runner cannot break the printed subroutine on this ice except using a fracter. [subroutine] End the run unless the Runner suffers 3 net damage.
title: Semak-samun

flavor: Peer reviews are the difference between living in the arcs and living in the slums. Cloneline gengineering never made anything as vicious or cutthroat as a Jinteki scientist.
stripped_text: Reveal all but 1 card in HQ. Gain 7 credits. You may install 1 card from HQ in the root of a remote server.
text:
Reveal all but 1 card in HQ.
Gain 7[credit]. You may install 1 card from HQ in the root of a remote server.
title: Peer Review

flavor: Spring-loaded minds, kept in suspension to be launched into the net at any incursion.

text: Whenever the Runner approaches a piece of ice protecting this server, you may trash this upgrade. If you do, gain 3[credit] and you may swap the ice being approached with a piece of ice from Archives or HQ.
title: Mitra Aman

flavor:
Igniting your potential.
Never stop shining.

text: The first time each turn a tag is removed, you may reveal and install 1 card from HQ, ignoring all costs. [click], remove 1 tag: Gain 2[credit].

title: Next Big Thing

flavor: You don’t really want to know what makes you unique as a person. It’s so much less than you think.

You can advance this asset.
When your turn begins, you may trash this asset. If you do, for each hosted advancement counter, gain 3[credit] and the Runner loses 2[credit].
title: Idiosyncresis

flavor:
“Give me five minutes of a user’s Access Plaza traffic and I’ll tell you where they’re having lunch tomorrow. Give me another ten, and I’ll have their bibi’s secret rendang recipe.”
—Luzviminda Reyes, Synapse Sales
stripped_text: When your turn begins, gain 1 credit. Threat 2 -> When the Runner trashes this asset (while it is rezzed), give them 1 tag.
text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit]. Threat 2 → When the Runner trashes this asset (while it is rezzed), give them 1 tag.

flavor:
They know what makes you tick.
And ticked-off.

[subroutine] Give the Runner 1 tag.

flavor:
”On the Net, we hold the power.”
 —Arnold Teoh, NBN technologist
stripped_text: 3 credits: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. Subroutine End the run. Subroutine If the threat level is 2 or greater, end the run. Subroutine If the threat level is 4 or greater, end the run.
text: 3[credit]: Break 1 subroutine on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] If the threat level is 2 or greater, end the run. [subroutine] If the threat level is 4 or greater, end the run.
title: N-Pot

stripped_text: Play only if the Runner is tagged. Resolve 1 of the following: * Give the Runner 1 tag. * Remove any number of tags. The Runner loses 5 credits for each tag removed this way. Gain credits equal to the number of credits the Runner lost.
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged. Resolve 1 of the following:
  • Give the Runner 1 tag.
  • Remove any number of tags. The Runner loses 5[credit] for each tag removed this way. Gain credits equal to the number of credits the Runner lost.
title: Bigger Picture

flavor: “I believe you have something of ours.”
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, remove X tags. Install 1 agenda from the Runner's score area with a printed agenda point value equal to X. If the Runner is still tagged, place 1 advancement counter on that agenda.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, remove X tags.
Install 1 agenda from the Runner’s score area with a printed agenda point value equal to X. If the Runner is still tagged, place 1 advancement counter on that agenda.
title: IP Enforcement

flavor: “Your Star Power is in the toilet, kid. We need a fresh face.”
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend click. Place 2 advancement counters on 1 installed card you can advance. If you do, choose a card type and reveal the grip. Choose up to 2 revealed cards of that type. The Runner shuffles those cards into the stack.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Place 2 advancement counters on 1 installed card you can advance. If you do, choose a card type and reveal the grip. Choose up to 2 revealed cards of that type. The Runner shuffles those cards into the stack.
title: Touch-ups

flavor: We’ll be there.
stripped_text: You may install agendas faceup. (This does not make their abilities active.) Whenever the Runner accesses a faceup installed agenda, do 2 meat damage and give the Runner 1 tag.
text: You may install agendas faceup. (This does not make their abilities active.) Whenever the Runner accesses a faceup installed agenda, do 2 meat damage and give the Runner 1 tag.
title: BANGUN: When Disaster Strikes

flavor: Action at a distance.
stripped_text: The first time each turn you gain credits through an ability on an agenda or operation, you may draw 1 card.
text: The first time each turn you gain credits through an ability on an agenda or operation, you may draw 1 card.
title: The Zwicky Group: Invisible Hands

flavor: “It’s been a real pleasure doing business with you.”
stripped_text: When you score this agenda, gain 2 credits. When you forfeit this agenda, gain 4 credits.
text:
When you score this agenda, gain 2[credit].
When you forfeit this agenda, gain 4[credit].
title: Greenmail

stripped_text: Dividends 1 (When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for each excess advancement counter.) When your discard phase ends, you may remove 1 hosted agenda counter to search R&D for 1 card and reveal it. (Shuffle R&D after searching it.) You may install that card, ignoring all costs. If you do not, add it to HQ.
text: Dividends 1 (When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for each excess advancement counter.) When your discard phase ends, you may remove 1 hosted agenda counter to search R&D for 1 card and reveal it. (Shuffle R&D after searching it.) You may install that card, ignoring all costs. If you do not, add it to HQ.
title: Off the Books

flavor:
“If you lived here, you’d be at work by now!”
—Weyland recruiter
stripped_text: When you rez this asset, load 8 credits onto it. When it is empty, trash it. When your turn begins, take 4 credits from this asset and draw 1 card.
text:
When you rez this asset, load 8[credit] onto it. When it is empty, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 4[credit] from this asset and draw 1 card.
title: Anthill Excavation Contract

flavor: “Rejoice, executives! The Net has sent unto us a profit!”

text: As an additional cost to rez this asset, forfeit 1 agenda or reveal and trash 3 cards from HQ. When your turn begins, you may play 1 transaction operation from Archives. After it resolves, remove it from the game.

—Moira Virtue, Ice Engineering, KKU

stripped_text: Resolve 2 of the following in any order: * Draw 1 card. Shuffle 1 card from HQ into R&D. * Install 1 piece of ice from HQ, ignoring all costs. * Place 1 advancement counter on an installed card you can advance. * Gain 2 credits.
text:
Resolve 2 of the following in any order:
  • Draw 1 card. Shuffle 1 card from HQ into R&D.
  • Install 1 piece of ice from HQ, ignoring all costs.
  • Place 1 advancement counter on an installed card you can advance.
  • Gain 2[credit].

—Luana Campos, Weyland spokesperson
